thread.title: Man dies in car wreck on way to brother's funeral | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Man dies in car wreck on way to brother's funeral | Daily Mail Online

author: Anna Hopkins For Dailymail.Com
title: Man dies in car wreck on way to brother's funeral | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The recently retired EMT was thought to be the oldest living EMT in the history of South Carolina Aiken County Coroner Tim Carlton said still was driving a Lincoln Town Car, the Aiken Standard reported. Carlton also said that Still may have been the oldest living EMT in the history of South Carolina, having just recently retired at 82. Authorities say Still's grandchild and a friend were with him in the car and were taken to the hospital along with the driver of the other car. Still's brother Rodney, both of Walterboro, South Carolina, passed away just a few days prior Their conditions were not released. Still's brother Rodney, both of Walterboro, South Carolina, passed away just a few days prior on February 7. Rodney, 74, had been married to his wife Helen for 42 years, the Augusta Chronicle reported. He was an avid lover of NASCAR, reading, and traveling. Read more:
